 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Data Engineer
description:
**📊 Data & Analytics Engineer - Stockholm (Hybrid)** 




  





*Shape the future of data-driven decision-making in a modernising enterprise* 




  





 A well-established Swedish company is undergoing a major digital transformation and is looking for a
 **Data & Analytics Engineer** 
 to help build and optimise its new cloud-based data platform. This is a unique opportunity to join a small, high-impact team at the early stages of a long-term data modernisation journey.
 



  





 You’ll work across the full data lifecycle - from ingestion and modelling to orchestration and reporting - using modern tools like DBT, Power BI, and Azure Data Factory. The role blends elements of analytics engineering, BI development, and data pipeline optimisation, offering broad exposure and real ownership.
 



  





 🧠 What You’ll Do
 


* Own and evolve the company’s DBT-based data models, supporting business-critical reporting and analytics
* Build and maintain Power BI dashboards that deliver actionable insights to stakeholders
* Collaborate with business users to understand data needs and translate them into scalable models
* Orchestrate and monitor data pipelines using Azure Data Factory
* Optimise Snowflake usage and cost, and contribute to performance tuning
* Support legacy SQL Server-based data flows and help plan their gradual migration to the cloud
* Work closely with a small team to shape the company’s modern BI architecture



  





 🛠 Tech Stack
 


* **Core** 
 : SQL, DBT, Power BI, Snowflake
* **Cloud & Orchestration** 
 : Azure, Azure Data Factory, Blob Storage
* **Other** 
 : Python (for light scripting), Git, Medallion architecture (Bronze/Silver/Gold)



  





 🎯 What We’re Looking For
 


* Strong SQL skills and experience with data modelling and transformation
* Familiarity with DBT or a strong interest in learning it
* Experience building reports in Power BI or similar tools
* Understanding of data orchestration and pipeline monitoring (e.g., ADF, Airflow)
* Ability to work across both backend and frontend data layers
* Interest in staying up to date with new features and best practices in the data ecosystem
* Swedish language proficiency is required due to stakeholder interaction and on-call responsibilities



  





 💼 Role Details
 


* **Location** 
 : Sollentuna, Stockholm (50/50 hybrid)
* **Benefits** 
 : Competitive salary, Union agreement, pension, wellness allowance, and more
* **Team** 
 : You’ll work alongside a small but growing data team, with lots of room to shape processes and tooling



  





 🚀 Why This Role?
 


* Join a company at the start of a major cloud and data transformation
* Work with modern tools and architectures in a greenfield environment
* Take ownership of key systems and influence long-term strategy
* Be part of a stable, profitable business with a strong customer base and ambitious tech leadership

title: Engagement Manager - Pharma/ MedTech
description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.
   

  

**Your role**
 As an Engagement Manager - Pharma/ MedTech you will be responsible for providing leadership and direction to achieve the company’s growth and transformation. You will identify opportunities to drive engagement and build engagement plans that are aligned with the business strategy. As Engagement Manager you will be accountable for client engagement and client satisfaction on a day-to day basis including scope, time, budget, and quality.
   

  

**As An Engagement Manager You Will**
* Managing Capgemini and Client expectations
* Ensuring compliance to engagement delivery requirements (contracted scope, time, budget and quality)
* Addressing all client requests and concerns
* Building relationships and collaborating with clients
* Managing the engagement strategy
* Tracking and managing all engagement metrics
* Providing regular reporting on engagement performance


**Your profile**
* Extensive experience from the Life Science Industry (Pharma/ MedTech)
* Understanding of IT application maintenance & support services for cloud as well as on premise enterprise systems
* Understanding of DevOps, ALM, and other software development processes, methods and tools
* Experience in GxP
* Proven track record in operational management and in project delivery
* Ability to manage customer expectations
* Communication and people management skills
* Problem solving skills
* Crisis management skills
* Project management certification is a plus
* Certification in frameworks like ITSM and ITIL is a plus


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* We support your personal development and offer an education library with more than 250 000 (!) courses and educations and certifications.


**Application**
 As part of our recruitment process, identity verification or background checks may occasionally be conducted.
   

  

**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion. Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: Sales Director
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage and Freight and Package Transportation
description:
Plats: Sverige (på distans eller på kontoret)
 



 Kontrakt: Tillsvidareanställning
 



  





 DP World är i hjärtat av Europas handelsframtid och tillhandahåller rätt handelsinfrastruktur, smarta logistiska lösningar och fördelarna med hamnverksamhet till våra kunder. Vi är den ledande leverantören av logistik och använder branschledande teknik för att ytterligare bredda vår digitala vision för att störa världshandeln, samtidigt som vi säkerställer en positiv och hållbar inverkan på ekonomier, samhällen och vår planet.
 







 Vi är på en resa mot att bli den ledande leverantören av logistiklösningar från början till slut och end- end logistiklösningar är en viktig del av denna resa. Vi ska nu etableras i Sverige och redo för tillväxt.
 







 Försäljningsdirektören är avgörande för tillväxten av våra globala end-end logistiklösningar i Sverige.
 







 Vår ideala kandidat kommer att ha omfattande erfarenhet av spedition, starka ledaregenskaper och en dokumenterad meritlista inom kommersiell strategi och försäljning. Du behöver inte kryssa i alla rutor för att vara vår perfekta kandidat – vårt rekryteringsteam är angelägna om att prata med erfarna försäljningsledare som är redo för utmaningen att forma denna nya satsning.
 



 Om rollen
 



 Så här kan du bidra:
 


* • Utveckla och implementera en regional försäljningsstrategi för end-end logistiklösningar i linje med DP Worlds globala mål.
* • Leda, vara mentor och hantera säljteamet för att säkerställa hög prestanda.
* • Generera effektiva leads och affärsmöjligheter baserat på ditt befintliga nätverk och affärsbok.
* • Uppfylla och överträffa finansiella tillväxtmål för både teamet och dig själv.
* • Bygga relationer med viktiga beslutsfattare på alla nivåer inom kundorganisationer.
* • Upprätthålla en djup förståelse för kundernas förväntningar, operativa lösningar och marknadsutmaningar.
* • Förstå kundernas köpprocesser och identifiera alla influenser och krav.
* • Upprätthålla en uppdaterad pipeline av möjligheter, kvantifiera värde och omvandla till avslut
* • Koordinera RFQ:er, egna kommersiella relationer och kontraktsförhandlingar.
* • Säkerställa efterlevnad av interna kommersiella processer
* • Främja samarbete mellan Account Management, Operations, Tender Management och andra funktioner.
* • Samarbeta med kollegor i andra regioner för att skapa bredare möjligheter för globala kunder.
* • Fungera som ambassadör för DP World och främja positiva beteenden och säkerhetsstandarder.
* • Resor över hela Sverige och internationellt efter behov (30 – 50 %).



 Vad du kommer att ta med dig
 



 Kvalifikationer
 


* • Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att uppnå försäljningsmål och driva affärstillväxt.
* • Stark ledarskaps- och teamledningsförmåga.
* • Utmärkt kommunikations-, förhandlings- och interpersonell kompetens.
* • Strategisk tänkare med stark analytisk och problemlösande förmåga.



 Uppleva
 


* • Minst 10 år inom transport, logistik eller spedition, med fokus på internationell frakt.
* • Betydande erfarenhet av värdeförsäljning.
* • Erfarenhet av att leda och leda ett team av ämnesexperter.
* • Befintlig erfarenhet av affärer och end-end logistiklösningar är en stark tillgång.



 Färdigheter
 


* • Kommunikation – Exceptionell förmåga att lyssna, skriva och tala.
* • Problemlösning – Kreativt och analytiskt förhållningssätt till utmaningar.
* • Detaljorienterad – Stark uppmärksamhet på detaljer och organisatoriska färdigheter.
* • Kritiskt tänkande – Förmåga att identifiera luckor och underliggande orsaker till problem.
* • Samarbete – Arbetar självständigt och tvärs över mångkulturella team.
* • Resultatorienterad – Proaktiv och deadline-driven med en positiv attityd.
* • Konfidentialitet – Upprätthåller diskretion med företagsdata.
* • IT-kompetens – Kunnig i Microsoft Office Suite och CRM-verktyg.
* • Språk – flytande svenska och engelska; Ytterligare språk är en bonus.



 Ersättning
 



 DP World erbjuder spännande och utmanande roller inom en växande internationell organisation. Vi strävar efter att anställa och utveckla rätt personer, vilket stimulerar personlig tillväxt och självutveckling i en informell atmosfär. Vi erbjuder ett marknadsmässigt konkurrenskraftigt kompensationspaket.
 



 Om DP World
 



 Handel är livsnerven i den globala ekonomin och skapar möjligheter och förbättrar livskvaliteten för människor runt om i världen. DP World finns till för att få världens handel att flyta bättre och förändra vad som är möjligt för de kunder och samhällen vi betjänar globalt.
 







 Med ett dedikerat, mångsidigt och professionellt team med mer än 111 000 anställda från 159 nationaliteter, som spänner över 77 länder på sex kontinenter, driver DP World handeln längre och snabbare mot en sömlös leveranskedja som är redo för framtiden.
 







 Vi omvandlar och integrerar snabbt våra verksamheter – Hamnar och terminaler, Marintjänster, Logistik och Teknik – och förenar vår globala infrastruktur med lokal expertis för att skapa starkare, effektivare helhetslösningar för leveranskedjan som kan förändra hur världen handlar.
 







 Dessutom omformar vi framtiden genom att investera i innovation. Från intelligenta leveranssystem till automatiserad stapling av lager ligger vi i framkant när det gäller disruptiv teknik och driver sektorn mot bättre sätt att handla och minimera störningar från fabriksgolvet till kundens dörr.
 







 DP World har ett uppdrag att överskrida gränser och överbrygga klyftan mellan alla nationer och kulturer – inte bara i vad vi gör utan också i hur vi beter oss.
 







 Vi är dedikerade till att skapa en kultur där alla känner sig respekterade, stöttade och bemyndigade att nå sin fulla potential. Vi tror att inkludering och mångfald driver innovation och tillväxt och hjälper oss att koppla samman människor, företag och samhällen. Fria sinnen och olika perspektiv förändrar vår värld, och tillsammans kan vi förändra vad som är möjligt.
 







 DP World-familjen består bland annat av Syncreon, Imperial, P&O, Unifeeder med mera
 







 VI FÅR HANDELN ATT FLÖDA FÖR ATT FÖRÄNDRA VAD SOM ÄR MÖJLIGT FÖR ALLA.

title: Lösningsarkitekt ServiceNow
description:
**Att jobba som lösningsarkitekt ServiceNow**
 Som lösningsarkitekt ServiceNow hos Skandia blir du en del av vårt ServiceNow & Configuration team i Stockholm bestående av utvecklare, arkitekt och processpecialister.
   

  

 Teamets övergripande mål är att säkra ett driftstabilt Skandia. Du får möjlighet att påverka såväl plattformens strategiska inriktning som de dagliga tekniska lösningarna. I din roll leder du utveckling och förvaltning av ServiceNow, samverkar nära verksamheten, designar lösningar utifrån verksamhetskrav och säkerställer att dessa implementeras enligt best practice. Vardagen är varierad från att sätta den långsiktiga arkitekturella roadmappen till att ibland bistå vid felsökning och arbete hands-on i plattformen.
   

  

 Du får arbeta tvärfunktionellt med Skandias olika affärsområden från IT och säkerhet till HR, juridik och inköp, vilket ger både bredd och möjlighet till verkligt inflytande över plattformens framtid.
   

  

 Vi arbetar hybrid vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete. I rollen kommer du att rapportera till gruppchef IT process & leveransstöd.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen**
 Vi tror att du har gedigen erfarenhet av ServiceNow och tidigare har arbetat som lösningsarkitekt. Du har jobbat med ITSM, CMDB, Discovery samt dagligen designat och underhållit API-integrationer. Du uttrycker dig obehindrat på både svenska och engelska, i tal såväl som skrift. Meriterande är om du har kunskap om ITIL och SAFe.
   

  

 Som person är du målmedveten, engagerad och noggrann. Din styrka ligger i att analysera behov, förklara komplexa lösningar och driva arbetet framåt tillsammans med andra på olika nivåer.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Monica Eriksson på monica.eriksson@skandia.se.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocessen ta kontakt med Talent Acquisition Partner Harald Brehmer på harald.brehmer@skandia.se.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
   

  

 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Lösningsarkitekt – Data & Analytics (Microsoft Fabric/Azure)
description:
**Om uppdraget**
 Vill du vara med och bygga nästa generations dataplattform i Microsoft Fabric? Vår kund söker en
 **erfaren lösningsarkitekt** 
 som kan leda arbetet med att etablera en modern plattform med medaljarkitektur (bronze–silver–gold). Du blir en
 **nyckelspelare** 
 i ett
 **spännande transformationsprojekt** 
 där Azure Synapse, SSIS och SSAS ersätts av en framtidssäkrad lösning i Fabric.
   

  

**Dina ansvarsområden**
* Designa målarkitekturen för dataplattformen i Fabric.
* Etablera och driva medaljarkitektur (bronze/silver/gold).
* Definiera strategi för on-prem databaser (Fabric databases/lakehouses).
* Coacha och vägleda interna resurser och konsulter.
* Säkerställa att lösningen möter verksamhetens behov, KPI:er och säkerhetskrav.
* Ge rekommendationer kring kostnadsoptimering och best practice i Azure/Fabric.


**Vi söker dig som har:**
* 7–10 års erfarenhet av dataplattformsarkitektur.
* Djup kompetens inom Microsoft Fabric (Lakehouse, Direct Lake, Semantic Models).
* Gedigen erfarenhet av Azure Data Platform (Synapse, SSIS, SSAS, SQL Server).
* Kunskap inom BI-arkitektur (Power BI, SSRS).
* Erfarenhet av större migrerings-/transformationsprojekt.
* Förståelse för säkerhet och accessmodeller i Azure.
* Flytande svenska och engelska.


**Personliga egenskaper**
 Du är kommunikativ, van att arbeta nära verksamheten och har en stark förmåga att översätta affärskrav till tekniska lösningar. Du har ledaregenskaper och trivs i en roll där du får coacha andra.
   

  

**Varför Ictech?**
* Konsulter som trivs bra: 95% tycker att vi är en ideal arbetsgivare
* Flexibel lönemodell där du styr löneuttag, semester och val av uppdrag... Eller en fast lönemodell beroende på vad du föredrar!
* Låg personalomsättning (6%)
* Våra medarbetare har en snitterfarenhet på 14 år, med bred kompetens


 Som anställd på Ictech får du möjlighet att
 **utvecklas både tekniskt och professionellt** 
 genom uppdrag hos olika kunder inom flera branscher – ofta med stor flexibilitet. Vi tror på att våra konsulter gör störst nytta när de får använda sin expertis i uppdrag som verkligen passar dem, och vi ser till att
 **du har inflytande över vilka uppdrag du tar dig an** 
 .
   

  

**Vi värdesätter det personliga** 
 : för oss är rätt person på rätt uppdrag avgörande och vi har få anställda per chef för att säkerställa rätt stöd och tid. Det ger resultat,
 **100% skulle rekommendera oss för en vän** 
 och
 **97% känner sig uppskattade av sin chef** 
 .
 **Det är siffror vi är stolta över!**
 Vi erbjuder
 **kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling** 
 genom utbildningar och nya tekniska utmaningar, samtidigt som du är en del av en stark företagskultur där gemenskap, omtanke och arbetsglädje står i centrum.
   

  

 Hos oss har du också stor frihet att påverka din arbetssituation. Vi erbjuder
 **konkurrenskraftig lön** 
 och
 **riktigt generösa förmåner** 
 – och du kan själv välja mellan en flexibel eller traditionell lönemodell, beroende på vad som passar dig bäst.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Låter det här som något för dig? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Vi ser fram emot att höra mer om dig.

title: Global field operations field engineer, EMEA GFO Eng team
description:
**Description**
 EMEA GFO is seeking a passionate, results oriented engineer to drive operational excellence in its colocation based data center operations. This position serves as a technical resource to support Amazon Web Services (AWS) within its geographically distributed Global field operations. The position will drive overall availability and reliability to meet or exceed the defined service level expectations of data center operations.
   

  

 The Global field engineer will be responsible for working with Biz development on site qualification and selection. In addition the engineer will be responsible for working with the Colo providers to oversee the operation and maintenance of all electrical, mechanical, and HVAC equipment in multiple colocation data centers. This equipment supports mission-critical servers and networking equipment with high uptime expectations. The Global Field Engineer will identify and drive projects to maintain high reliability and performance while keeping operating costs in facilities at a minimum. Where appropriate, the engineer will drive innovation cooperatively with the colocation facility to reduce operational costs. A strong sense of ownership will be demonstrated for this position.
   

  

 The Global Field Engineer is Amazon’s front line technical subject matter leader when it comes to hands-on electrical and mechanical equipment operations and troubleshooting. They will work with the Colo provider and Biz Development to ensure the ongoing maintenance and operations of Data Center Operation’s Mission Critical Facilities, which includes stand-by diesel generators and related fuel systems, 3 phase electrical systems that include but not limited to switchgear, UPSs, PDUs, wet cell batteries and associated systems, CRAC, centrifugal chillers, cooling towers/water chemical system, air handlers and associated systems, pumps, & motors.
   

  

 \*Please note that this role will require up to 60% travel around the EMEA area\*
   

  

 AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help.
   

  

 You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* Supervise, advise and collab with Colocation operators performing servicing or preventive maintenance.
* Assist in performing root cause analysis for operational issues.
* Perform periodic on site reviews and audits of operations, electrical, and mechanical systems
* Supervise the design and implementation of retrofits of existing facilities
* Qualify new sites for new deployments
* Drive operational excellence in all data center sites
* Perform first level trouble-shooting for facility and rack level events.
* Approval of all CMs (Change Management Tasks) to enable changes and maintenance at sites.
* Attending weekly calls with both TPMs and CAD designers, designing and retrofitting new and existing cages within our EMEA edge space.


**About The Team**
 ABOUT AWS:
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree in Electrical / Mechanical Engineering or equivalent depending on where you received your qualification.
* Have a strong working knowledge and experience of the purpose and infrastructure of a Data Center. In-depth knowledge of UPS, backup generator systems and generic mechanical-room infrastructure such as chillers, Cooler Units, and fan controls


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience in operations and on-call support for Data Center facilities or Mission Critical Plants/Production facilities;
* Project Management experience


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - Amazon Data Services Sweden AB
   

  

 Job ID: A2967222

title: CRM Developer, Salesforce focus
description:
**Solve real business problems by building and scaling CRMs and applying AI into digital strategy. We are looking for you who want to work in cross-functional teams, have autonomy in your work and build our CRM offering together with us. Let's find your Road!**
 Who we are
   

  

 We are Columbia Road, a Nordic digital sales consultancy dedicated to transforming how companies grow. We create scalable, data-driven solutions with customer experience at the core. By combining CRM expertise, modern data platforms, and AI-enabled marketing and sales, we help our clients orchestrate personalised customer journeys, automate at scale, and deliver measurable commercial impact.
   

  

 Our clients include ambitious B2B and B2C companies — from global consumer brands to leading industrial players. We work at the intersection of technology, design, and business, solving complex challenges and building solutions that drive sustainable growth.
   

  

 At Columbia Road, you’ll join a flat and entrepreneurial organisation with the freedom to lead, challenge, and shape both your own career and our growing presence in Sweden. You will join a small ambitious team in Sweden and be a part of a group of hundreds of experts in the nordics.
   

  

 The job & what you’d be working on
   

  

 We are strengthening our Salesforce and CRM capabilities in Stockholm and looking for experienced consultants who want to play a key role in both client success and our local growth journey.
   

  

 As a CRM / Salesforce Developer at Columbia Road, you will:
   

  

* Build and scale CRM solutions (preferably Salesforce) that unlock data-driven insights and improved customer experiences within sales, marketing and service.
* Act as a trusted advisor to clients — helping them connect business strategy with technology, improve sales processes, and identify opportunities for automation and AI.
* Contribute to developing new commercial opportunities, building networks, and growing our presence in Sweden.
* Work in cross-functional teams with consultants, designers, and developers to deliver real business impact.


 This is a senior role suited to someone who enjoys combining technical expertise with business acumen, and who is curious about the potential of AI and intelligent agents in transforming sales and marketing.
   

  

**Skills And Experience We Expect You To Have**
* Hunger to drive change and create business value
* Solid hands-on experience with CRM, preferably Salesforce (Sales, Service, Marketing, Experience and Data Clouds).
* Ability to connect business requirements with technical solutions — turning data into insights and scalable processes.
* Experience with integrations between CRM and other business systems (ERP, marketing automation, data platforms).
* Knowledge of data modelling and customer data architecture to enable scalable solutions.
* Curiosity around AI and automation in marketing and sales.
* Proven consulting skills: problem-solving, communication, and client management.
* Track record in developing commercial relationships and contributing to business growth.
* Fluency in Swedish and English (professional level).


**The Following Are Considered An Advantage**
* Agency or consultancy experience
* Familiarity with marketing automation tools (e.g. Marketing Cloud, Pardot).
* Salesforce development skills (Lightning, APEX, Visualforce) and architectural understanding.


 Why join us
   

  

* Work with the best: Collaborate with top CRM (in addition to Salesforce), data, design, and tech experts across the Nordics.
* Get to solve real business problems (not just implementing solutions), applying AI into digital strategy, implementation and operations.
* Freedom to lead: Shape projects, influence decisions, and build our Salesforce practice in Sweden.
* Competitive package: Salary, benefits, flexible work, and a modern office in central Stockholm.
* Never stop learning: Support for Salesforce certifications and growth towards roles like Salesforce Architect or Team Lead.
* Culture that connects: Regular team events, offsites, and a strong Nordic community that values collaboration and fun.


 Recruitment process
   

  

 Our recruitment process typically involves 2-3 interviews where we learn about your skills and what motivates you. You'll discover more about Columbia Road and meet various Roadies along the way. After our discussions, we'll reach out to your chosen references. We look forward to hearing from you soon!
   

  

**Benefits**
* A community-led organisation with a high level of autonomy
* A diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace
* Option to buy stocks of the company through the common employee share program
* A yearly bonus based on company performance (equal to all full-time Roadies)
* Recurring training and learning sessions to support your professional growth
* Offices in central Stockholm, Drottninggatan 33, with daily breakfast & snacks
* A wide selection of quality tools to use for your work (laptop, phone etc.) and a mobile phone subscription
* Health services incl. mental health, and insurance
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Recurring Roadie-ideated events and activities
* Compensation for working on open source or social programs in your free time


 We help companies sell better by building seamless digital solutions and running concrete growth activities. Find your Road with us by exploring open jobs or Connecting with us!

title: Data Platform Architect
description:
**Title:** 
 Data Platform Architect
   

  

**Reports to:** 
 Head of Architecture
   

  

**Group:** 
 Digital and Synthetic
 **Capability:** 
 Architecture
   

  

**Level:** 
 S5
   

  

**Work Arrangement:** 
 Hybrid
   

  

**Company Overview**
 Metrea is a defense company dedicated to translating commercial innovation into solutions for the hardest problems in national security. With deep mission expertise, Metrea focuses on delivering effects-as-a-service across Aerospace, Electromagnetic & Cyber, Digital & Synthetic domains via its capability groups. Metrea also consists of six support groups (Operations, People, Finance, Legal, Strategy and Solutions) that guide the development of specific capabilities that Metrea's files (product, projects, programs etc) leverage to achieve their targets.
   

  

**Group Overview**
 The
 **Digital and Synthetic Capability Unit (D&S)** 
 is committed to providing mission-driven information solutions that seamlessly bridge the digital and physical realms. Leveraging cutting-edge technologies and advanced platforms, we empower operational readiness and elevate situational awareness across diverse domains—including air, maritime, and space.
   

  

**Position Summary**
 We are seeking an experienced Data Platform Architect to lead a cross-functional data & cloud engineering team in the design and implementation of our next-generation cloud-native data platform.
   

  

 This role will be responsible for architecting a comprehensive data ecosystem that supports diverse data ingestion and consumption patterns, advanced data structures, and appropriate storage solutions while owning and adhering to our data ontology.
   

  

**Role And Responsibilities**
**Architecture & Design**
* Design and architect scalable, cloud-native data platform solutions supporting both real-time and batch processing workloads
* Define data architecture patterns, data models, and integration strategies across heterogeneous data sources
* Establish API-first design principles and create comprehensive API specifications for data services
* Design data governance frameworks, security models, and compliance strategies
* Create technical roadmaps and guide technology stack decisions


**Technical Leadership**
* Lead a cross-functional team including data engineers, cloud engineers, and software engineers
* Collaborate with data scientists and analytics teams to understand platform requirements for advanced use cases
* Drive architectural reviews and technical decision-making processes
* Mentor engineering teams on best practices for data platform development
* Establish coding standards, design patterns, and operational procedures


**Platform Strategy**
* Evaluate and recommend technologies for data ingestion, processing, storage, and serving layers
* Design multi-tenant, self-service data platform capabilities
* Architect solutions for data lineage, quality monitoring, and observability
* Plan for platform scalability, performance optimization, and cost management
* Ensure platform supports diverse data types (structured, semi-structured, streaming)


**Stakeholder Collaboration**
* Work closely with product managers to translate business requirements into technical solutions
* Partner with security and compliance teams to ensure data protection and regulatory adherence
* Collaborate with infrastructure teams on cloud resource planning and optimization
* Present architectural decisions and trade-offs to leadership and technical teams


**Skills And Experience**
* 8+ years of experience in data engineering, platform architecture, or related fields
* Technologist with proven experience in building innovative and ground-breaking data solutions.
* Proven experience architecting large-scale data platforms in cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP) and leading technical teams
* Deep understanding of data processing frameworks (Spark, Kafka, Flink, Airflow)
* Strong knowledge of data storage technologies (data lakes, data warehouses, NoSQL, streaming)
* Experience with containerization, orchestration (Kubernetes, Docker), and microservices and event-driven architectures
* Proficiency in API design and development (REST, GraphQL, gRPC, JSON, Kafka)
* Understanding of data governance, security, and compliance frameworks
* Excellent communication skills with ability to present complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
* Solid programming fundamentals with ability to review code and guide technical decisions across multiple languages
* Experience with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, CloudFormation)
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices
* Knowledge of monitoring and observability tools (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK stack)
* Experience with data catalog and metadata management tools


**Additional Eligibility Qualifications**
* Advanced degree in Computer Science or Engineering
* Understanding of analytics and data science workflows
* Certification in major cloud platforms
* Experience with data mesh or federated data architecture patterns


**Our Culture**
 Metrea’s single core value, “rooted in humility,” is supported by four key attributes: entrepreneurial, systematic, discerning, and over-deliver. These attributes, combined, form our Teammate Firmware, our culture. We explore these attributes during the hiring process when we grow our teams and continually support the growth of our culture. We are a hyper-collaborative, dynamically hierarchical organization united by a passion for what we do, how we do it, who we do it with, and who we do it for.
   

  

**Benefits**
 D&S UK
   

  

 Private Medical Insurance
   

  

 Subsided gym membership / plans through Wellhub
   

  

 Electric Car scheme
   

  

 Cycle to work scheme
   

  

 £1500 Training Allowance
   

  

 30 days annual PTO plus b/h
   

  

 Eye Tests
   

  

 D&S Sweden
   

  

 Friskvård of 5K annually
   

  

 Personal development budget (2K for books, courses, subscriptions etc)
   

  

 Parental leave
   

  

 5% occupational pension (swe. tjänstepension),
   

  

 30 days of leave
   

  

 Discretionary Bonus
   

  

**Right to Work**
 The employee will have the legal right to work in the United Kingdom and will be able to produce right to work documentation.
   

  

**Work Authorization / Security Clearance**
 Ability to achieve and maintain a Security Clearance.
   

  

**Equal Opportunities Statement**
 Metrea Management is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or other characteristics protected by law.
   

  

**Position Type and Expected Hours of Work**
 This is a full-time non-exempt position with typical working hours of Monday through Friday, 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. Hours and work shifts may change in accordance with department and business needs. Exempt Employees must have the ability to be on-call and available, as business needs require. Non-Exempt employees may be required to work over 40 hours per week with approval from the department manager.
   

  

**Work Location**
 UK / Sweden
   

  

**Work Environment**
 This job operates in an office setting

title: Machine Learning Engineer
company_industry: Information Services and Technology, Information and Media
description:
**Job Title: Research / Applied Research Engineer – Machine Learning / AI (Remote – Sweden)** 




  





**Experience Required: 4–5 Years** 




**Location: Remote (Candidates must be based in Sweden- Fluent in Swedish)** 




  





**About the Role** 




 We are looking for a talented Research / Applied Research Engineer with 4–5 years of experience in algorithm development, model design, and experimentation. The candidate will contribute to cutting-edge AI/ML projects, translating research into practical solutions with real-world impact.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




 Conduct research and applied research in machine learning and AI to design novel algorithms and models.
 



 Develop, experiment, and optimize models to solve complex problems.
 



 Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate research outcomes into products.
 



 Analyze and interpret data to guide model development and improvement.
 



 Stay up-to-date with the latest trends in ML/AI research and apply innovative approaches.
 



 Document methodologies, experiments, and results for internal knowledge sharing.
 



  





**Required Skills & Qualifications** 




 4–5 years of experience in Machine Learning, Deep Learning, or Applied AI research.
 



 Strong background in algorithm development, statistical modeling, and experimentation.
 



 Proficiency in Python and ML frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn.
 



 Experience in research publications or implementation of research algorithms is a plus.
 



 Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
 



**Fluent in Swedish.** 




  





**Nice to Have** 




 Experience in MLOps or deploying research models to production.
 



 Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) for research experiments.
 



 Exposure to NLP, Computer Vision, or Generative AI applications.

title: Supplier Quality Engineer
description:
**Your Title:** 
 Supplier Quality Engineer
   

  

****Job Location** 
 :** 
 Sweden - Danderyd
   

  

****Om Rollen****
 Ditt ansvar är att säkerställa kvaliteten på inköpt material för mekanikartiklar, gjutna, bearbetade samt plastartiklar. Det inkluderar att utreda leverantörsberoende avvikelser i produktionen, följa upp kvalitetsdata, sätta standarder för kvalitetskontroll hos leverantörer, utvärdera och verifiera nya och befintliga artiklar, granska nya och befintliga leverantörer samt initiera och följa upp reklamationsärenden
   

  

 Du har daglig kontakt och samarbete med operativ inköpare, strategisk inköpare och projektinköpare samt samarbete med produktionen och R&D-avdelningen.
   

  

 Eftersom Trimble verkar i en internationell och dynamisk miljö erbjuds du en spännande roll med många internationella kontakter. En del resor ingår i tjänsten.
   

  

**Formel Bakgrund Och Erfarenhet**
 Rätt person har en akademisk examen från universitet och relevant erfarenhet från produktionsföretag. Vidare önskar vi:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av leverantörskvalitet;
* Erfarenhet av kvalitetsmetoder och standarder;
* Leverantörsrevisioner;
* Mycket god engelska, både muntlig och skriftlig, samt goda kunskaper i svenska är meriterande.


**Personliga Egenskaper**
 För att lyckas i rollen är det viktigt att du har förmågan att självständigt genomföra aktiviteter mot uppsatta mål. Du bör vara analytisk, strukturerad och van vid att hantera mycket data.
   

  

 Som person ser vi att du är en social person som trivs med att arbeta i team med andra mot gemensamma mål. Du är kundfokuserad, affärsinriktad och van vid att arbeta i ett högt tempo i en internationell miljö.
   

  

 Vidare är du driven och resultatinriktad med ett stort intresse för kvalitetssäkring.
   

  

****Arbetsplats****
 Du kommer att arbeta på vårt kontor i Sverige - Danderyd.
   

  

**About Trimble**
 Dedicated to the world’s tomorrow, Trimble is a technology company delivering solutions that enable our customers to work in new ways to measure, build, grow and move goods for a better quality of life. Core technologies in positioning, modeling, connectivity and data analytics connect the digital and physical worlds to improve productivity, quality, safety, transparency and sustainability. From purpose-built products and enterprise lifecycle solutions to industry cloud services, Trimble is transforming critical industries such as construction, geospatial, agriculture and transportation to power an interconnected world of work. For more information about Trimble (NASDAQ: TRMB), visit: www.trimble.com
   

  

****How to Apply:****
 Please submit an online application for this position by clicking on the ‘Apply Now’ button located in this posting.
   

  

****Posting Date****
 09/10/2025
   

  

****Application Deadline:****
 Applications could be accepted until at least 30 days from the posting date.
   

  

****Join a Values-Driven Team: Belong, Grow, Innovate.****
 At Trimble, our core values of Belong, Grow, and Innovate aren't just words—they're the foundation of our culture. We foster an environment where you are seen, heard, and valued (Belong); where you have an opportunity to build a career and drive our collective growth (Grow); and where your innovative ideas shape the future (Innovate). We believe in empowering local teams to create impactful strategies, ensuring our global vision resonates with every individual. Become part of a team where your contributions truly matter.
   

  

 Trimble’s Privacy Policy
   

  

 If you need assistance or would like to request an accommodation in connection with the application process, please contact AskPX@px.trimble.com.

title: (Senior) IT Consultant - Principal Investors and Private Equity | BCG Platinion
description:
Who We Are
   

  

 Do you want to turn the challenges of digitalization into the solutions of the future? Join BCG Platinion in tackling the core IT issues of leading global companies. Deploy customized platforms, architectures, strategies, and organizations to leverage the digital potential of our customers and drive true innovation, with state-of-the-art tools such as cloud computing, AI, blockchain, microservices, and containerization. Add your individual strengths to our unique team, always there to support you. Together with Boston Consulting Group and our clients, we turn digital visions into reality.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 More so than ever, technology is driving business growth and must therefore be a top consideration in M&A decision making. Assessing technological capabilities in the due diligence phase requires knowledge across IT architecture, enterprise systems and cybersecurity – we are looking for passionate talent! As a (Senior) IT Consultant for our PIPE (Principal Investors & Private Equity) practice area, you will be focused on helping the world’s largest private equity firms address their strategic technology challenges, whether they are buying or selling a business. We look for new colleagues in our offices in Stockholm, Helsinki, Oslo, and Copenhagen!
   

  

 What You'll Bring
   

  

**You can help us make a difference if you**
 ▪ bring multiple years of experience in IT strategy and consulting, professional software development or IT project management in a tech related corporate development or start-up
   

  

 ▪ gathered basic understanding of technology financials and how it impacts deal value
   

  

 ▪ are familiar with working within a Merger and Acquisition (M&A) environment, with a focus upon technology due diligence, technology carve-out, technology PMI or PE-related value creation initiative with a portfolio company
   

  

 ▪ are a strategic thinker who likes to work creatively and analytically in an environment focused on exceptional problem-solving
   

  

 ▪ bring stellar analytical and conceptual skills, strong customer focus and mental agility with a result-orientation
   

  

 ▪ obtained a university degree with above average academic performance in a STEM related field or business management
   

  

 Who You'll Work With
   

  

**Shape the world of tomorrow**
 ▪ You will drive groundbreaking projects by using agile methods and modern approaches within the scope of strategic IT implementation for clients and by actively steering the relevant modules
   

  

 ▪ You will smooth the path for tailored, future-oriented customer journeys based on precise analysis of the situation and with current market developments and trends, such as machine learning, in mind
   

  

 ▪ You will design and optimize unique IT architectures within the framework of enterprise solution requirements, modern custom software developments, and sustainable digital solutions, including cyber resilience
   

  

 Additional info
   

  

**How You Can Grow With Us**
 We guarantee constant development incentives in an open and rewarding work environment! Together with a dedicated team of top talents, you get to work on new challenges every day. Individual training offers and a culture of open feedback will provide the framework needed to explore and perfect personal strengths. Our modern structures allow focusing on the essence of our work - with easy travel booking, an excellent back-office support and comprehensive Knowledge Center. With our regular office Fridays and legendary events, we cultivate a strong and close team network beyond our case work.
   

  

*BCG Platinion is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable.*
*#BCGPlatinion*
 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
   

  

 BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: Bioinformatician in In Situ Sequencing
emails: katarina.tiklova@scilifelab.se, chika.yokota@scilifelab.se, st@st.su.se, st@st.su.se, saco@saco.su.se, saco@saco.su.se, seko@seko.su.se, seko@seko.su.se
description:
**The Department of Biochemistry and Biophysics.** 
 SciLifeLab (SciLifeLab) is a national center for molecular biosciences with focus on health and environmental research. The center combines frontline technical expertise with advanced knowledge of translational medicine and molecular bioscience. SciLifeLab is a national resource hosted by Karolinska Institutet, KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Stockholm University and Uppsala University. The center also collaborates with several other universities.
   

  

 For more details about the facility, visit: www.scilifelab.se/facilities/in-situ-sequencing/.
   

  

 The employment will be placed at the Department of Biochemistry and Biophysics, at Stockholm university. More information about us, please visit: www.dbb.su.se.
   

  

 Main responsibilities
   

  

* Perform in-depth analysis of complex spatial transcriptomics / In situ sequencing datasets using established computational frameworks
* Ensure data management practices align with the FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable) principles, including metadata annotation and long-term storage solutions
* Provide expert support to researchers on all data-related aspects, from experimental design to analysis and interpretation
* Contribute to the development of integrative, multi-modal analysis pipelines for spatial omics datasets
* Design and implement novel analytical approaches and interactive visualizations tailored to high-dimensional multi-modal spatial data.


 Qualification requirements
   

  

**Required Qualifications**
* A PhD (or MSc with significant experience) in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Systems Biology, or a related discipline
* Proficiency in Python and R, with experience in spatial transcriptomics data analysis and high-dimensional data visualization
* Demonstrated experience in building and maintaining reproducible and modular data analysis workflows
* Solid understanding of statistical methods and their application to transcriptomics and image-derived data
* Familiarity with public biological data repositories, metadata standards and best practices in open science
* A collaborative mindset, with the ability to work in interdisciplinary teams and communicate effectively with both computational and experimental scientists.


*Desirable (but not required)* 
 :
   

  

* Experience with imaging technologies (e.g., Xenium, MERFISH, seqFISH) and associated data formats
* Familiarity with cloud computing environments or high-performance computing clusters
* Knowledge of tissue segmentation, spatial registration, or histology-based data alignment.


*Personal Skills*
 We believe success in this role requires curiosity for biological questions and enthusiasm for learning new bioinformatics tools and methods. You enjoy working as part of a team, with a structured and quality-focused mindset. Strong communication skills, both spoken and written, are essential. We place great emphasis on personal qualities.
   

  

**About The Employment**
 This is a full-time, indefinite-term employment with a six-month probationary period. Stockholm University applies individual salary setting. Start date is as soon as possible.
   

  

 We offer
   

  

 With us, you will experience the dynamic interaction between higher education and research that makes Stockholm University an exciting and creative environment. You will work in an international environment and get favourable conditions.
   

  

 Stockholm University strives to be a workplace free from discrimination and with equal opportunities for all.
   

  

 Contact
   

  

 Further information about the position can be obtained from Katarina Tiklova, katarina.tiklova@scilifelab.se, or Chika Yokota chika.yokota@scilifelab.se.
   

  

 Application
   

  

 Apply for the position at Stockholm University's recruitment system. It is the responsibility of the applicant to ensure that the application is complete and that it is submitted before the deadline.
   

  

 The instructions for applicants are available at: How to apply for a position.
   

  

 Stockholm University contributes to the development of sustainable democratic society through knowledge, enlightenment and the pursuit of truth.

title: Sales Executive Infrastruktur
description:
**Bygga, utveckla och underhålla starka kundrelationer**
 Dalux utvecklar och säljer innovativa och marknadsledande mjukvarulösningar till entreprenörer inom anläggning och infrastruktur. Vi är i en mycket stark tillväxtfas och söker därför en målmedveten Sales Executive med stark analytisk förmåga som kan bidra till att bygga, utveckla och underhålla starka kundrelationer.
   

  

 I denna nya tjänst blir du ansvarig för att driva försäljningsaktiviteter som kommer vara avgörande för Dalux’ fortsatta tillväxt på svenska marknaden. Du styr din egen tid med kunden i fokus och trivs med att skapa resultat genom långsiktiga och starka kundrelationer. Du jobbar nära dina kollegor på Stockholmskontoret.
   

  

 Några av dina ansvarsområden kommer vara
   

  

* Identifiera nya försäljningsmöjligheter för befintliga och nya kunder
* Skapa och underhålla långsiktiga och goda kundrelationer
* Säkerställa en bra implementering av Dalux’ mjukvara hos kund i samarbete med våra duktiga Customer Success Managers
* Stödja befintliga och nya kunder med teknisk rådgivning om Dalux’ mjukvara
* Representera Dalux på mässor, konferenser, webinarier med mera


 Du kommer främst jobba med aktörer inom byggbranschen, med fokus på anläggning och infrastruktur, till exempel ledande entreprenörer och tekniska konsulter.
   

  

**Proaktiv och serviceinriktad lagspelare**
 Kanske kommer du från en liknande tjänst där du har byggt upp omfattande erfarenhet av att sälja komplexa B2B-SaaS-tjänster. Eller så har du annan erfarenhet som är relevant för oss. Du jobbar proaktivt och strukturerat med starkt kundfokus och serviceinriktning. I möten med kund förstår du hur du på et konstruktivt och professionellt sätt kan både förstå och utmana kundens behov. Du trivs med förhandlingar på hög nivå samtidigt som du kan skapa goda relationer till slutanvändarna. Du har god affärsförståelse och ett levande intresse för ny teknik. Du är flytande på både svenska och engelska i skrift och tal.
   

  

**Ta del av succén**
 Du erbjuds en tjänst i en växande organisation där vägen är kort från idé till handling. Med vår nyskapande produktportfölj räds varken vi eller våra kunder för att kalla oss teknologiska banbrytare. Du blir en del av ett team som jobbar nära tillsammans och hjälper varandra med stort och smått. Vår kultur präglas av nytänkande, hjälpsamhet och viljan att göra skillnad för våra kunder och våra kollegor.
   

  

 Har du frågor är du välkommen att kontakta Talent Acquisition Specialist, Maja Curth, via mcu@dalux.com eller +45 24237682. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan och CV så snart som möjligt. Intervjuer hålls löpande.
   

  

**Om Dalux**
 Dalux är en internationell marknadsledare i ständig tillväxt inom mjukvara. Sedan 2005 har vi jobbat för att göra bygg- och fastighetsbranscherna smartare och mer effektiva. Våra användarvänliga BIM-teknologi (3D-informationsmodeller) och digitala verktyg används i dag av ledande entreprenörer, beställare och konsulter i mer än 140 länder. Dalux jobbar varje dag med att flytta gränserna för hur teknologi kan hjälpa människor att skapa smartare och mer hållbara arbetsprocesser i bygg- och fastighetsbranscherna. I nära samarbete med våra användare optimerar vi kontinuerligt befintlig teknologi och utvecklar lösningar som bryter ny mark. Under de senare åren har vi presenterat flera världsnyheter; bland annat världens snabbaste BIM-viewer och BIM-baserad.
   

  

**Application deadline:**
 As soon as possible

title: Technical Program Manager - AI Evals & Strategy
description:
**About Us**
 At Legora, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.
   

  

 You are joining an early-stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin and Bird & Bird. Backed by over $110M in funding from top investors including ICONIQ, General Catalyst, Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, Slack, and top tier consulting and law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.
   

  

 The role
   

  

 As a
 **Technical Program Manager for AI Evaluations** 
 , you’ll drive the strategy and execution of our evaluation efforts from inception to release. You will own the evals roadmap end-to-end in partnership with product and engineering to enable faster and better product delivery. You’ll also coordinate across internal stakeholders and external vendors to plan, track, and deliver initiatives, while implementing monitoring systems and analyzing outcomes to translate insights into actionable feedback.
   

  

 As our platform scales rapidly, you’ll play a central role in building a world-class evaluation function that ensures the performance, reliability, and integrity of our product matches our ambition.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Manage evaluation projects end-to-end: own timelines, deliverables and internal and external resources across the full range of evaluation needs and initiatives.
* Define evaluation objectives, methods, and success criteria in partnership with product, engineering and legal engineering teams.
* Interface with cross-functional teams to ensure evaluation strategies are not only aligned with product goals and technical capabilities but also actively facilitate the creation of evaluations to enable faster and better product delivery.
* Coordinate external contributors, from legal experts and research partners to client companies, and integrate their input into evaluations that drive capabilities. You’ll define scopes, onboard contributors, and ensure high-quality outputs that meet technical and product standards.
* Evaluate and translate results of evaluation into real improvements for the product and engineering.


 Who you are
   

  

* Strong academic background in Engineering or related field, with a degree from a top-tier university.
* 2+ years of experience as a Technical Program Manager, management consultant, or a similar project-driven role in fast growing organizations.
* Proven track record of successfully delivering complex projects, including stakeholder management and cross-functional coordination.
* Excellent communicator who can simplify and align technical and business goals.
* Interest in and understanding of AI models, evaluation methods, and AI product development.
* Energized by building from scratch — hands-on, pragmatic, and motivated by getting things over the line. You don’t get hung up on details, but push through to get things done.


 What's in it for you
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


 We founded Legora to empower lawyers with the tools they truly deserve. We’re not building for the way law is practiced today - we’re reimagining how it will be practiced tomorrow.

title: Backend (AWS) Developer
description:
Navigraph is currently looking for a Fullstack Developer to join our Sim dev team in central Stockholm. This is an excellent opportunity for someone who wants to work in a developer team in a mid-size company, serving a large and passionate user base worldwide. 🌍✈️
 




  





**About Navigraph** 





 Navigraph is a SaaS company providing aviation fans and aspiring pilots with charts, navigation data, flight planning tools, and training material. Our users fly everything from Microsoft Flight Simulator to X-Plane. With our Electronic Flight Bag, virtual avionics, flight planning tools, performance calculators, and teaching material we’re the trusted co-pilot for any serious virtual aviator.
 





  
 





 We have a modern tech stack for our main apps based on React and React Native, and also specialized GIS data pipelines and simulator integrations based on Rust (compiled to WASM) — all with a strong focus on usability and modern design. Our mission? To make flight simulation as realistic and immersive as possible by making data, software, and tools like those available to the aviation industry accessible for flight simulation gaming.
 




  






 With our HQ in Stockholm and a global crew of c. 50 aviation-loving professionals, led by our founders Magnus Axholt (CEO) and Stephen O’Connell (CTO), our team thrives on creativity, experimentation and collaboration. Join us, and you’ll discover a vibrant community, a thriving business, and a workplace where innovation takes off every day.
 




  






 Check out our career site for more information on who we are ✨. 
 




  





**What We’re Looking For!** 





 We need someone with experience across the full stack who loves solving challenges, writing clean, 
 





 efficient code and an eye for details.
 




  





**Required Skills** 



* Proven record of building and maintaining robust software
* Proficiency in TypeScript, Node.js, and relational databases
* Proficiency with backend development and system design
* Proficiency with managing cloud infrastructure - preferably AWS
* Proficiency working with DevOps
* Fluent in written and spoken English



  





**Bonus Skills** 



* Experience with React
* Experience with frontend development
* Understanding of principles in navigation and geography
* Passion for flight simulation and aviation
* Experience with flight simulator avionics



  





**What You Could Be Doing!** 




  




* Work with high-volume, real-time flight data streams, supporting detailed visualisation and analysis
* Work with our extensive cloud-native processing pipelines, optimizing and improving our workflows
* Develop and maintain APIs that provide 3rd parties and in-house applications with valuable navigation datasets, ranging from navigation data to real-time simulator traffic insights.
* Ensure that Navigraph remains top-of-mind for new and well-established simulator add-on developers through innovations in developer experience and first-class direct developer support
* Shape the infrastructure and CI/CD processes around our projects
* Develop and maintain flight simulator integrations, often as part of research-focused projects that aim to bridge the gap to the real world
* Design, develop and maintain the backends of our products.



  





**What We Offer!** 




  




* **Flexible Work Options** 

 : On-site and hybrid.
* **A great benefits package** 

 : please check out our career site.
* **Growth Opportunities** 

 : We’ll support your professional development and give you the resources to excel.
* **Memorable experiences** 

 : The Navigraph team is a tight-knit group with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We enjoy spending time together, and it is not uncommon for our yearly trips to flight simulator conventions in Europe and the U.S. to be combined with team-building activities that leave lasting impressions!



  





**How to Join the Team?** 





 We’re reviewing applications quickly - so don’t leave us hanging too long! 🚀✈️ Apply now and help us take Navigraph - and flight simulation - to the next level!

title: Java Developer
description:
Join Sii Sweden as a Java Developer and contribute to a large-scale, modern cloud-based solution for the financial sector. You will work with microservices, AWS, and cutting-edge Java features, helping to deliver reliable, high-performance systems used by millions of users globally.
   

  

****Your tasks****
* Develop and maintain backend services using Java and Spring Boot
* Work with AWS cloud services (S3, SQS, ECR/Fargate)
* Design and enhance microservices architecture
